question: 1 (e)
sols_html:
We use the three regions from part (d).

  • Case 1: If \(0 < |a| \leq 1\) then

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = 2/|a|\end{aligned}\]

has the solutions a = 1/2, that is, a = -1/2 and a = 1/2.

  • Case 2: If \(1 \leq |a| \leq 2\) then

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = 2\end{aligned}\]

has no solutions.

  • Case 3: If \(2 \leq |a|\) then

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 4 = \mathrm{cond}(A) = |a|\end{aligned}\]

has the solutions a = -4 and a = 4.

Overall we have that cond(A) = 4 holds if a = -4, a = -1/2, a = 1/2 or a = 4.

statement_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & a & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

where a is a real number.

(e) For what values of a (if any) is cond(A) = 4?
